title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no children node listing.
EB: The data set editor page should display the children node listing after changing the data source for a data set in the query tab.
SR:
To reproduce: 
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 
2. Select a new data source that has no database/table/column information. 
3. Observe that there is no children node listing. 
4. Close the data set editor and reopen it to check if the issue persists.
